title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 26 January 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:04 <CIA-32> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r0f3fb8f / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/resources/ApplicationResources.properties : XWIKI-7439: Category becomes invisible when adding a subcategory with the same name as parent category ...  
00:04 <rrodriguez> has quit  
00:18 <Enygma`1> has joined #xwiki  
00:21 <Enygma`> has quit  
00:56 <tekzilla> has quit  
00:58 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
01:21 <+sburjan`> hello sdumitriu  
01:36 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
01:49 <Enygma`1> has quit  
02:06 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
02:51 <@sdumitriu> Hi sburjan`  
06:00 <Denis2> has joined #xwiki  
06:02 <Denis> has quit  
06:22 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
07:26 <tejaswini> has joined #xwiki  
07:27 <tejaswini> has quit  
07:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:05 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: in case you haven't figured it out yet, the problem is indeed that the category page has empty content. It used to have the include macro for the sheet, but that's not needed with the new sheet system. I had the same problem with App Within Minutes, see my comment to XWIKI-7268 . I changed XWikiDocument#mergeXObjects to not add the objects if they already are there, in order to minimize the problem (at least in my case). i.e the page is saved, but   
08:06 <+mflorea> The real issue is the test in readFromTemplate, that checks for empty content. It's there from the beginning, I think, but I don't understand why we need it.  
08:07 <@sdumitriu> I think it should test for isNew()  
08:07 <+mflorea> yep  
08:31 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:41 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
09:00 <vmassol> mflorea: you forgot to apply our support best practice ;)  
09:00 <+mflorea> vmassol: thanks for creating an extension (I should have done it)  
09:00 <+mflorea> but  
09:00 <vmassol> hehe  
09:01 <+mflorea> your code doesn't work :P  
09:01 <vmassol> I tried it  
09:01 <+mflorea> I've tested it first  
09:01 <vmassol> me too  
09:01 <+mflorea> hmm  
09:01 <vmassol> what doesn't work for you?  
09:01 <+mflorea> setCreatorReference doesn't mark metdata dirty on the document  
09:02 <+mflorea> the creator wasn't changed after save  
09:02 <+mflorea> it was with setCreator though  
09:02 <+mflorea> let me try again your snippet  
09:02 <vmassol> well I went to the page  
09:02 <vmassol> and looked at the bottom  
09:02 <vmassol> where it prints the creator  
09:02 <vmassol> and it was the one I put  
09:03 <vmassol> now  
09:03 <vmassol> do we have a bug?  
09:05 <vmassol> hmm actually I don't understand something  
09:05 <+mflorea> hmm, indeed, it works, but it didn't work with my code, let me see what's the difference  
09:05 <vmassol> I'm looking at     protected void saveDocument(String comment, boolean minorEdit) throws XWikiException  
09:05 <vmassol> there is:         doc.setAuthorReference(currentUserReference);  
09:05 <vmassol> ah forget that  
09:05 <vmassol> it's the author not the creator  
09:05 <+mflorea> yes, it's author  
09:05 <+mflorea> yep  
09:05 <vmassol> :)  
09:05 <vmassol> I mixed up  
09:05 <vmassol> if the doc is new though my script will not work  
09:06 <vmassol> since there is:  
09:06 <vmassol>         if (doc.isNew()) {  
09:06 <vmassol>             doc.setCreatorReference(currentUserReference);  
09:06 <vmassol>         }  
09:06 <+mflorea> indeed  
09:06 <vmassol> but then the script is about changing it so it's ok  
09:06 <vmassol> now I'm checking if it's correct not to set the metadata dirty  
09:08 <qwebirc48701> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <qwebirc48701> has quit  
09:08 <vmassol> I think it jsut means the doc date is not changed  
09:09 <vmassol> hmm updateXWikiDocArchive is not called either in this case I think  
09:09 <vmassol> that's strange since I saw a new rev was created  
09:10 <vmassol> debugging  
09:10 <+mflorea> yes, a new rev is added  
09:13 <vmassol> content dirty and metadata dirty are true  
09:13 <vmassol> trying to find where they're set  
09:18 <vmassol> hmm  
09:18 <vmassol> when setAuthorReference is called isContentDirty and metadata dirty are already set to true  
09:18 <vmassol> still looking  
09:19 <vmassol> that's because they are the defaults  
09:19 <vmassol>     /\*\*  
09:19 <vmassol>      \* Used to make sure the MetaData String is regenerated.  
09:19 <vmassol>      \*/  
09:19 <vmassol>     private boolean isContentDirty = true;  
09:19 <vmassol>     /\*\*  
09:19 <vmassol>      \* Used to make sure the MetaData String is regenerated.  
09:19 <vmassol>      \*/  
09:19 <vmassol>     private boolean isMetaDataDirty = true;  
09:19 <vmassol> hmmm  
09:23 <vmassol> so basically when you get a document the frist time it's always true  
09:24 <vmassol> till you make a change to it  
09:24 <vmassol> then ithey're set to false  
09:24 <+mflorea> ah  
09:24 <vmassol> this doesn't look right  
09:24 <vmassol> since it means incurring extra overhead even if nothing was changed  
09:24 <+mflorea> so a save without changes will create a new rev  
09:24 <vmassol> yes  
09:25 <vmassol> so my script doesn't work if:  
09:25 <vmassol> you get the doc make a first change then change the creator  
09:25 <vmassol> (save after the first change)  
09:25 <vmassol> I'll fix setAuthorRef and setCreatorRef  
09:26 <vmassol> tmortagne/sdumitriu: ok?  
09:26 <vmassol> (just want to be sure)  
09:26 <@sdumitriu> +1  
09:26 <+tmortagne> vmassol: sorry did not seen there was a message, reading  
09:27 <vmassol> I'm NOT going to make the big change of having metadata/content dirt to false when creating an XWikiDocument instance  
09:27 <vmassol> but I think we should do it at some point  
09:28 <+tmortagne> sounds ok to me  
09:29 <vmassol> so for setAuthorReference it becomes:  
09:29 <vmassol>     public void setAuthorReference(DocumentReference authorReference)  
09:29 <vmassol>     {  
09:29 <vmassol>         if ((getAuthorReference() == null && authorReference != null)  
09:29 <vmassol>             || (getAuthorReference() != null && !getAuthorReference().equals(authorReference))) {  
09:29 <vmassol>             setMetaDataDirty(true);  
09:29 <vmassol>         }  
09:29 <vmassol>         this.authorReference = authorReference;  
09:29 <vmassol>     }  
09:29 <vmassol> and I'm remving the if from setAuthor  
09:29 <vmassol> (since it calls setAythorReference)  
09:30 <+tmortagne> would be easier to read with StringUtils.equals (it taking care of null)  
09:30 <+tmortagne> ObjectUtils sorry  
09:30 <+tmortagne> ( vmassol )  
09:32 <vmassol> need to think if it's the same  
09:32 <vmassol> we're not checking if the passed ref is null btw right now  
09:33 <vmassol> ObjectUtils.equals(null, "")                    = false  
09:33 <+tmortagne> yep, you want to know if they are not equals to setMetaDataDirty, all the things around null check is just to not get nullpointer  
09:33 <vmassol> empty string?  
09:33 <+tmortagne> what sttring ?  
09:33 <+tmortagne> it's references  
09:33 <vmassol> I'm readin the javadoc: http://commons.apache.org/lang/api-2.6/org/apache/commons/lang/ObjectUtils.html#equals(java.lang.Object, java.lang.Object)  
09:33 <+tmortagne> null is not the same as ""  
09:33 <vmassol> they do "instanceof"?  
09:34 <vmassol> looks slow  
09:34 <+tmortagne> I don't see what's wrong with ObjectUtils.equals(null, "") =false  
09:34 <vmassol> how do they check this?  
09:35 <+tmortagne> check what ?  
09:35 <vmassol> that the object is an empty string  
09:35 <vmassol> they must do some instanceof  
09:35 <+tmortagne> I don't understand, what would they need to know that the string is empty ? one is null the other is not so they are not equals  
09:35 <vmassol> same for Boolean  
09:36 <+tmortagne> no need for instanceof  
09:36 <vmassol> they don't say:  
09:36 <vmassol> ObjectUtils.equals(null, whatever)                    = false  
09:36 <vmassol> it has to be an empty sting to be false  
09:36 <vmassol> strig  
09:36 <vmassol> string  
09:36 <vmassol> anyway  
09:36 <+tmortagne> vmassol: :  
09:36 <+tmortagne>     public static boolean equals(Object object1, Object object2) {  
09:36 <+tmortagne>         if (object1 == object2) {  
09:36 <+tmortagne>             return true;  
09:36 <+tmortagne>         }  
09:36 <+tmortagne>         if (object1 == null || object2 == null) {  
09:36 <+tmortagne>             return false;  
09:36 <+tmortagne>         }  
09:36 <+tmortagne>         return object1.equals(object2);  
09:36 <+tmortagne>     }  
09:36 <+tmortagne> pretty simple  
09:36 <+tmortagne> and preatty much excatly what you did  
09:37 <+tmortagne> no no there is no instanceof  
09:37 <+tmortagne> and I don't see wy you want it to use instanceof  
09:37 <vmassol> then i don't understand their javadoc  
09:37 <+tmortagne> ObjectsUtils is just here to not jet nullpointer that's all  
09:37 <+tmortagne> so to replace all your checks on null  
09:38 <+tmortagne> s/jet/get/  
09:38 <vmassol> ok using ObjectUtils  
09:38 <vmassol> still their javadoc looks wrong to me  
09:38 <+tmortagne> it's the same as StringUtils.equals but for any object basically  
09:38 <+tmortagne> not sure why StringUtils is actually needded  
09:38 <+tmortagne> never looked their javadoc :)  
09:39 <+tmortagne> "Compares two objects for equality, where either one or both  
09:39 <+tmortagne>      \* objects may be {@code null}." seems ok to me  
09:40 <+tmortagne> they should maybe make explicit that both object need to be null or none to be equals if that's what you mean  
09:40 <+tmortagne> but not sure it's really needed  
09:42 <+tmortagne> i think you read  
09:42 <+tmortagne> ObjectUtils.equals(null, "") = false  
09:42 <+tmortagne> the wrong way, it's false because the first one in null and not the second one that's all  
09:42 <+tmortagne> s/in/is/  
09:42 <vmassol> yes but there's no point in putting a specific value in the second one  
09:42 <vmassol> that's misleading  
09:42 <vmassol> they should use: \*  
09:42 <+tmortagne> they wanted to put working code example  
09:42 <+tmortagne> I guess  
09:42 <vmassol> yes  
09:43 <+tmortagne> not sure whay they kept a different implementation in StringUtils#equals in commons-lang 3  
09:43 <+tmortagne> s/whay/why/  
09:52 <CIA-32> Vincent Massol master \* r885248a / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.java : XWIKI-7445: Setting the document creator doesn't always create a new revision - http://git.io/Z2JOEg  
09:53 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is even ObjectUtils.notEqual ;)  
09:53 <vmassol> ah :)  
09:53 <vmassol> you think it's best to use?  
09:53 <+tmortagne> I think I prefer ObjectUtils.notEqual, it's more clear what you check  
09:53 <+tmortagne> you can't miss the !  
09:54 <vmassol> ok changing  
09:54 <+tmortagne> but that mean calling two method which I guess cost a bit more unless the compilation optimize that  
09:54 <+tmortagne> s/method/methods/  
09:57 <CIA-32> Vincent Massol master \* r7b761ec / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.java : [Misc] Use ObjectUtils.notEqual() instead of !ObjectUtils.equals() for improved clarity - http://git.io/Ogs9XQ  
10:01 <vmassol> adding unit tests which I forgot to write… bad me....  
10:10 <CIA-32> Vincent Massol master \* rda7ec17 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/test/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocumentTest.java : XWIKI-7445: Setting the document creator doesn't always create a new revision ...  
10:15 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <vmassol> tmortagne: could you update http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Roadmap and remove stuff that was done for 3.4?  
10:28 <vmassol> + add stuff you plan to do for 3.5  
10:29 <vmassol> sdumitriu: same for you (I've removed done stuff for you I didn't check if they were done for 3.4 or 3.5 though - please correct if i've made amistake)  
10:29 <vmassol> note: we need someone to work on that page to make it work better. I don't have time today but I can do that next week  
10:29 <+tmortagne> vmassol: sure (send a mail about that yesterday btw)  
10:30 <+tmortagne> s/send/sent/  
10:30 <vmassol> yep, I still need to read it but this is why I'm asking you to update  
10:30 <vmassol> since I've seen comimts for 3.5  
10:30 <vmassol> so you need to separate the 3.4 from the 3.5 on the apge ;)  
10:31 <vmassol> btw mflorea  
10:31 <vmassol> I think you didn't propose a M1 for 3.5 right?  
10:31 <vmassol> but in jira there's a milestone-1 AFAICS  
10:32 <vmassol> we also need o verify that no dev has used @since 3.5M1  
10:32 <vmassol> (note that thomas stuff is more of milestone type than RC type ;))  
10:33 <+mflorea> there are already issues closed for 3.5M1  
10:33 <vmassol> mflorea: "I think you didn't propose a M1 for 3.5 right?"  
10:33 <+mflorea> checking  
10:33 <vmassol> renaming in jira is easy  
10:33 <+tmortagne> yep the proposal start with a RC1  
10:34 <vmassol> we just need to be sure we don't want a M1  
10:34 <+tmortagne> I'm not sure :)  
10:34 <+sburjan> me neither :)  
10:35 <vmassol> mflorea: ?  
10:35 <vmassol> do you feel like doing an additional release for 3.5?  
10:35 <vmassol> we could push the final for 3.5 by 1 week and introduce an M1  
10:35 <+mflorea> vmassol: I think I just copied this from an older proposal (yours I think) and just changed the dates. I haven't though about M1  
10:35 <vmassol> well it would have been fine  
10:36 <vmassol> if we didn't have to implement improvements/new stuff  
10:36 <vmassol> which is what thomas just did  
10:36 <vmassol> and you might also do that for app within minutes  
10:36 <+mflorea> ok  
10:36 <+mflorea> yes  
10:36 <vmassol> ? 3.5 M1: 6 February  
10:36 <vmassol> ? 3.5 RC1: 13 February  
10:37 <vmassol> 3.5 final: 20 Feb  
10:37 <vmassol> ?  
10:37 <+mflorea> yep  
10:37 <vmassol> you wish to send the mail proposal?  
10:37 <+mflorea> yes, I'll do it  
10:37 <vmassol> k  
10:38 <vmassol> you can explain that it's ebcause we have new stuff/improvements to make  
10:38 <+mflorea> sure  
10:39 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: around ?  
10:40 <@sdumitriu> Yep  
10:42 <+sburjan> sdumitriu: re XWIKI-7440 .I don't see any image picker  
10:42 <+sburjan> I don't see any "Choose an attachment" button  
10:43 <+tmortagne> vmassol: should I cleanup thing not done in 3.4 in http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/RoadmapArchives3xCycle or keep them since they were planned ?  
10:44 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:46 <vmassol> tmortagne: can you clean them for now?  
10:46 <vmassol> (we'll improve the strategy later on - this is what I meant)  
10:46 <vmassol> ideally  
10:46 <vmassol> if you could copy paste the description  
10:46 <vmassol> and paste it as normal text  
10:46 <vmassol> that would be best  
10:46 <vmassol> but if you don't want to bother, don't  
10:48 <+tmortagne> vmassol: ok cleaning  
10:49 <+tmortagne> the error in jira macro  is not very nice for unexisting issues :)  
10:49 <vmassol> the jira macro needs to be fully rewritten  
10:49 <vmassol> :)  
10:52 <+sburjan> yes  
10:53 <+sburjan> I don't think that can be fixed with the actual implementation  
10:54 <+sburjan> vmassol: I am ready for a call when you want  
11:14 <vmassol> tmortagne: what do we need to do to fix the preview on extensions.xwiki.org?  
12:11 <+tmortagne> vmassol: it's a new sheet system bug actually, so will be fixed by an upgrade to 3.4 probably  
12:11 <+tmortagne> upgrade that a need to do anyway to get the new XR improvements  
12:12 <+tmortagne> s/a need/I need/

14:26 <vmassol> (ie that there are keys)

14:31 <vmassol> just noticed  
14:31 <+mflorea> yep  
14:33 <sburjan\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:35 <pgmjsd> has quit  
14:35 <pgmjsd> has joined #xwiki  
14:37 <sburjan`> has quit

14:41 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
14:48 <vmassol> mflorea: hmm just got a stange behavior in appwithiinminute  
14:48 <vmassol> not sure how to reproduce  
14:48 <vmassol> I had a date field  
14:48 <vmassol> and when I added a second date field suddenly the page refreshed and I was looking at step 3  
14:49 <+mflorea> I've never seen this. It's strange  
14:50 <vmassol> mflorea: delete space is nice for this use case… starting over  
14:50 <+mflorea> :)  
14:50 <+mflorea> I'll add "Delete Application"  
14:53 <vmassol> mflorea: how can get a user field with autosuggest?  
14:53 <+mflorea> that's XWIKI-7368  
14:54 <vmassol> ok so I can't  
14:54 <vmassol> :)  
14:54 <+mflorea> yes, not yet  
14:55 <vmassol> mflorea: another pint  
14:55 <vmassol> point  
14:55 <vmassol> I went back to step 2 while I was filling step 3  
14:55 <vmassol> and I now lost my step3 data  
14:55 <+mflorea> that happens on any wizard  
14:55 <vmassol> not on good ones!  
14:56 <vmassol> atlassian ones save your data  
14:56 <vmassol> (AFAIR)  
14:56 <+mflorea> step 3 depends on step 2, so data you introduce in step 3 can become invalid if you go back and edit step 2  
14:57 <vmassol> I'm just reporting an issue from a user POV  
14:57 <vmassol> right now I cursed  
14:57 <vmassol> and thought: hmm this app is not well done  
14:57 <vmassol> as a user I don't even know if technically it's hard or not even possible :)  
14:58 <vmassol> at the very least  
14:58 <vmassol> it should warn you that you're going to loose your data and ask you if it's ok  
14:58 <+mflorea> ..as I said, for me it's logical that "going back" = "reset state"  
14:58 <vmassol> for you  
14:58 <vmassol> but not for anyone else  
14:58 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
15:00 <vmassol> mflorea: hmm I wonder if holiday request is a nice demo after all  
15:00 <vmassol> when I want to create a new entry it asks me for "Entry name"  
15:00 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <vmassol> I have no clue what thatmeans  
15:00 <vmassol> is it the page name?  
15:00 <vmassol> a technical name?  
15:00 <vmassol> should it be the user name?  
15:01 <vmassol> we need page generation for this right?  
15:01 <vmassol> page name generation I mean  
15:01 <+mflorea> isn't there a hint?  
15:01 <vmassol> I don't see any hint  
15:01 <+mflorea> yes, XWIKI-7374  
15:02 <vmassol> so when you design teh app you'll be able to check a box to tell it to generate page names for new entries?  
15:02 <+mflorea> yes  
15:02 <vmassol> ok still not very good for my demo :)  
15:03 <+mflorea> indeed, there's no hint below "Entry name". I'll add one.  
15:04 <vmassol> hmm right now the date field has a format of :"26/01/2012 14:54:31"  
15:04 <vmassol> I've changed it in the admin  
15:04 <vmassol> but I still see that format when I create a new entry  
15:04 <vmassol> any idea?  
15:04 <+mflorea> each date prop has a format meta prop  
15:05 <+mflorea> if you edit the class you can change the format of the date prop  
15:06 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
15:06 <evalica> has quit  
15:08 <vmassol> ah ok  
15:08 <vmassol> didn't know that  
15:09 <vmassol> thanks  
15:09 <+mflorea> np  
15:09 <vmassol> hmm something strange  
15:09 <vmassol> I edited the app  
15:09 <vmassol> but when I clicked save
